title: Anne-Marie Trevelyan – 2022 Comments on Visit to Burleigh Pottery
author: admin
summary: The comments made by Anne-Marie Trevelyan, the International Trade Secretary, in Stoke on 12 May 2022.
content:
It is great to see British businesses exporting across the world thanks to our brilliant free trade agreements. Businesses who export are support higher paying jobs, and help grow the economy across the UK.
  *[ERSA]: Employment Related Services Association
  *[HS2]: High Speed Two
  *[GPs]: general practitioners
  *[R+D]: research and development
  *[GVA]: gross value added - the measure of the value of goods and services produced in a sector
  *[CEOs]: chief executive officers
  *[OECD]: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development
  *[ESA]: Employment and Support Allowance
  *[
  ESA
 ]: Employment and Support Allowance
  *[EIF]: education inspection framework
  *[
  JTAIs
 ]: joint targeted area inspections
  *[JTAIs]: joint targeted area inspections
  *[
  ILACS
 ]: inspections of local authority children's services
  *[ILACS]: inspections of local authority children's services
  *[
  SEND
 ]: special educational needs and/or disabilities
  *[SEND]: special educational needs and/or disabilities
  *[EEF]: the Education Endowment Foundation
  *[DfE]: Department for education
  *[
  EIF
 ]: education inspection framework

Seeing Burleigh succeed shows the high demand for quality British products, and I will continue to champion great British exporting success stories in every sector.
